greenmirror

Class NullNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • greenmirror.Node
        • greenmirror.NullNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Observer

    public class NullNode
extends Node
    A class to handle removed Nodes better. It's an implementation of the null object design pattern. All the getters except for getOldName() and getOldType() return a null or false value and all the setters throw a NullNode.RemovedNodeUsedException.
    Author:
    Karim El Assal

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  NullNode.RemovedNodeUsedException
      An exception thrown when a removed node was used, which was impossible and essential.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class greenmirror.Node

        Node.Identifier

      • addRelation

        public @NonNull Node addRelation(@NonNull Relation relation)
        Description copied from class: Node
        Adds a Relation to this Node and the Node on the other end. The Relation should already have either node A or node B set to the other Node, so the current Node will be set to respectively node B or node A. If this Node already has relation, nothing happens. If the this node already has a placement relation, this method replaces it with the new relation. In any case, it notifies the observers.
        Overrides:
        addRelation in class Node
        Parameters:
        relation - the Relation to add
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullNode.RemovedNodeUsedException - because this node is removed

      • removeRelation

        public void removeRelation(Relation relation)
        Description copied from class: Node
        Removes relation from this Node. Optional operation. It does NOT notify the observers.
        Overrides:
        removeRelation in class Node
        Parameters:
        relation - the Relation to remove
        Throws:
        NullNode.RemovedNodeUsedException - because this node is removed

      • set

        public @NonNull Node set(@NonNull FxWrapper fxWrapper)
        Description copied from class: Node
        Sets the new FxWrapper. This can only be done once, although if the type is the same, it will re-set it. Observers get notified of the new FxWrapper and this Node starts observing the FxWrapper.
        Overrides:
        set in class Node
        Parameters:
        fxWrapper - the new FxWrapper
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullNode.RemovedNodeUsedException - because this node is removed

      • fx

        public @NonNull FxWrapper fx(@NonNull String type)
        Description copied from class: Node
        Tries to create a FxWrapper of the type passed in the argument and returns it. If the FxWrapper was already set and type is the same, it returns the set FxWrapper. If type is unknown or if it's a different type than the alrady set FxWrapper, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.

        If a new instance is created, the observer get notified.

        This method should be used in Groovy Scripts. For use in the GreenMirror application itself, see Node.getFxWrapper().

        Overrides:
        fx in class Node
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the FxWrapper. Except for the first character, the case has to match
        Returns:
        the just created or previously set FxWrapper
        Throws:
        NullNode.RemovedNodeUsedException - because this node is removed
        See Also:
        FxWrapper.getNewInstance(String)

      • fx

        public @NonNull FxWrapper fx()
        Description copied from class: Node
        Returns the previously set FxWrapper, or throws an IllegalStateException if it wasn't set yet. This method is meant to be used in Groovy user scripts.
        Overrides:
        fx in class Node
        Returns:
        the FxWrapper
        Throws:
        NullNode.RemovedNodeUsedException - because this node is removed

      • update

        public void update(Observable observable,
                   Object arg1)
        Description copied from class: Node
        Sends updates of the observees to its own observers. This means that the FxWrapper modified and the controller should know that so it can notify the server.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Observer
        Overrides:
        update in class Node
        Parameters:
        observable - the FxWrapper we're observing
        arg1 - any passed object from the observee
        Throws:
        NullNode.RemovedNodeUsedException - because this node is removed
